p: The aim of this study was to gather information on five medicinal plants from the Lamiaceae and Asteraceae family from Mt. Rtanj and the village of Sesalac in Eastern Serbia, to determine their EO yield and composition and compare the results with literature data on the same species. A second objective was to assess the antibacterial activity of these EOs against Staphylococcus aureus and Escherichia coli bacterial strains. Traditionally, the five plant species have been used by Serbian traditional medicine for treatment of various health conditions and diseases as outlined above.
